visualization_prompt: Generate a horizontal bar chart showing age-gender population distribution using mirrored negative/positive encoding
visualization_explanation: The visualization uses a horizontal bar chart with dual-direction encoding to represent population distribution. The dataset contains 11 ordinal age categories (0-9 to 100+) and two quantitative variables (male/female percentages). Synthetic data follows demographic patterns: 1) Exponential decay in population with age (μ=4.5%, σ=2.5), 2) Gender crossover at 70-79 where female percentages exceed males. Chart design applies Tufte's data-ink maximization through minimal gridlines and Cairo's salience principles via high-contrast gender encoding. Statistical anchors: Male distribution (skewness = -0.32) shows faster decline than female (skewness = -0.18), reflecting typical mortality patterns. Axis mirroring with negative values creates effective population pyramid morphology while maintaining numerical precision through D3-inspired percentage formatting.
